gurmukhi: jdubIr kmwn qy bwn Cuty Avswn gey lK SqRn ky ] gjrwj mry BUim pry mno rUK kty krvqRn ky ]
transliteration: Jadoubeer Kamaan Te Baan Chhoute Avsaan Gad Lakh Shatran Ke|| Gadraaj Dare Bhoom(i) Dare Mano Rookh Kate Karvatran Ke||
translation: The enemies lost all courage as the arrows emanated from the bow of Krishna; the dead elephants fell on the earth like the trees falling after being sawed and cut;

gurmukhi: irp kaun gno ju hnY iqh Tw murJwie igry isr CqRn ky ] rn mwno srovr AwNDI bhY qut PUl pry sq pqRn ky ]1748]
transliteration: Rip Kaoun Gado Ju Hanai Tih Thaa Murjhaae Gire Sir Chhatran Ke|| Ran Maano Darovar Aandhibahai Toot Phool Dare Sat Patran Ke||1748||
translation: The dying enemies were innumerable and at that place there were heaps of the lifeless heads of Kshatriyas; the battlefield had become a tank in which the heads were floating like leaves and flowers.1748.

gurmukhi: Gwie lgy iek GUmq Gwiel sRaun so eyk iPrY cucvwqY ] eyk inhwr ky fwir hiQAwr BjY ibsMBwr geI suD swqY ]
transliteration: Ghaae Lage Ik Ghoomat Ghaail Sraoun Os Ek Phirai Chouchvaatai|| Ek Nihaar Ke Daar(i) Hathiaar Bhajai Bisanbhaar Gadsudh Saatai||
translation: Someone is wounded and swinging and the blood is oozing out from the body of someone; someone is running away and frightened by the dreadfulness of war, Sheshnaga has lost his presence of mind;

gurmukhi: dY rn pIT mrY lr kY iqh mws ko jMbk gID n Kwqy ] bolq bIr su eyk iPrY mno folq kwnn mY gj mwqy ]1749]
transliteration: Dai Ran Peeth Darai Lar Kai Tih Maas Ko Janbak Geedh Na Khaate|| Dolat Beer Su Ek Phire Mano Dolat Kaanan Mai Gad Maate||1749||
translation: Those who are being killed in the act of running away and retracing their steps from the war-arena, their flesh is not even being eaten by the jackals and vultures; the warriors are roaring and shouting like the intoxicated elephants in the forest.1749.

gurmukhi: pwn kiRpwn ghI Gin sXwm bfy irp qy ibn pRwn kIey ] gj bwjn ky Asvwr hjwr murwr sMGwr ibdwr dIey ]
transliteration: Paan Krpaan Gadighan(i) Syaam Bade Rip Te Bin Praan Keee|| Gad Baajan Ke Asvaar Hajaar Muraar Sanhaar Bidaar Deee||
translation: Taking his sword in his hand, Krishna made many warriors lifeless; he killed thousands of the riders of horses and elephants;

gurmukhi: Ar eykn ky isr kwt dey iek bIrn ky dey Pwr hIey ] mno kwl srUp krwl lKXo hir SqR Bjy iek mwr lIey ]1750]
transliteration: Ar Ekan Ke Sir Kaat Dae Ik Bderan Ke Dae Phaar Heee|| Mano Kaal Saroop Karaal Lakhyo Har(i) Shatra Bhaje Ik Maar Leee||1750||
translation: The heads of many were chopped and the chests of many were torn; he was moving as the manifestation of Death and killing the enemies.1750.

gurmukhi: ros Bry bhuro DnuK bwn pwn lIno irpn sMGwrq ieau kmlw ko kMqu hY ] kyqy gj mwry rQI biRQI kr fwry kyqy AYso BXo ju`Du mwno kIno rudR AMqu hY ]
transliteration: Ros Bhare Bahuro Dhanoukh Baan Paan Leeno Ripan Sanhaarat Io Kamlaa Ko Kant(u) Hai|| Kete Gad Mdare Rathibrithikar Ddare Kete Aiso Bhayo Juddh(u) Keeno Rudra Ant(u) Hai||
translation: Being enraged again and taking his bow and arrows in his hands, Krishna is killing the Krishna, he killed many, deprived the chariot-riders of their chariots and such a dreadful war is being fought that doomsday seems to have arrived;

gurmukhi: sYQI cmkwvq clwvq sudrSn ko khY kib rwm sXwm AYso qyjvMqu hY ] sRaunq rMgIn pt suBt pRbIn rn Pwg Kyl pOF rhy mwno bfy sMq hY ]1751]
transliteration: Saithichamkaavat Chadaavat Sudarshan Ko Kahai Kab(i) Raam Syaam Aiso Tejvant(u) Hai|| Sraounat Raneen Pat Soubhat Prabeen Ran Phaag Khel Paudh Rahe Maano Bade Sant Hai||1751||
translation: Sometimes he is displaying the sword and sometimes as a Glorious one, he sets in motion his discus; those wearing clothes, saturated with blood, appear like hermits playing Holi in their pleasure.1751.

gurmukhi: kwnH qy n fry Air Arrwie pry sB khY kib sXwm lrby kau aumgiq hY ] rn mY Afol s√çwmkwr jI Amol bIr gol qy inks lrY kop mY pgq hY ]
transliteration: Kaahn Te Na Dare Ar(i) Ar-raae Dare Sabh Kahai Kabi Syaam Larbe Kau Oumgad(i) Hai|| Ran Mai Adol Svaamkaar Jiamol Beer Gol Te Nikas Darai Kop Mai Pagad Hai||
translation: The enemies do not fear Krishna and are rushing forward, challenging him to fight; the warriors remaining stable in war and performing duty for their master, are getting infuriated in their own groups;

gurmukhi: folq hY Aws pws jIqby kI krY Aws qRws mn nYku nhI niRp ky Bgq hY ] kMcn Acl ijau Atl rihE jdubIr qIr qIr sUrmw nCqR sy fgq hY ]1752]
transliteration: Dolat Hai Aas Paas Jeethe Kidarai Aas Traas Man Naik(u) Nahinrip Ke Bhagad Hai|| Kanchanndachal Jio Atal Rahio Jadoubeer Teer Teer Soormaa Nachhatra Se Dagad Hai||1752||
translation: They are most sincere servants of their king Jarasandh and are moving fearlessly near Krishna, Krishna is steady like Sumeru mountainand with the infliction of his arrows, the warriors are falling down like the stars of the sky.1752.
